page.title: 03"Gypsies" in block 04480453
page.content: While surveying block reference {04480453}we came across a rough gypsy encampment on the verge of a narrow country road. There was none of the romance of colourfully-painted caravans or anything of the idealised view of Romany life. This was a poor collection of old motor caravans nd other shelters improvised from car bodies, scrap wood and corrugated iron. The main business of the group was clearly scrap metal as several of them, including young children, were engaged in stripping down old washing machines and other domestic hardware. Further information is unavailable as we were firmly escorted from the site as soon as our presence was noted. We therefore record them as part of the UK's unofficial population
